page.title: 13 ST. MARYS LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: St Mary's lighthouse was the predecessor of the lighthouse on Priory Point in Tynemouth.Mr J.L.Miller started building the lighthouse on St. Mary's Island in 1896.Up until then there had been 6 major shipwrecks.It took nearly 3/4 million bricks ,eight thousand pounds and two years hard work.It is 110 ft. tall and has 137 steps.While they were building it they found stone coffins.They were the remains of people that had been shipwrecked or drowned due to the treacherous rocks surrounding the island.It wasn't until 1978 that the lighthouse was modernized to electricity.The light can be seen for 17 miles.On the 27th of November in 1984 the lighthouse was made redundant.The local council were appealing for donations to save the lighthouse.
